column1:
1949|eleven minutes to eight|When did you next see Dr. Wellesley?
"At just eleven minutes to eight."
"Where?"
"In the surgery."
"He came back there?"
"Yes."
"How do you fix that precise time--eleven minutes to eight?"
"Because he'd arranged to see a patient in Meadow Gate at ten minutes to eight. I glanced at the clock as he came in
column3: and reminded him of the appointment."

column1:
1949|Eleven minutes to eight|Eleven minutes to eight.
"You're always right; there must be a clock in your head."
"I can't be wrong
column2: tonight. I'll be able to tell you one second before they blast off. Look! The ten-minute warning!"
